Articles.Content:
My attempt to put a munbase for 4 kerbals on mun. A place for my stranded kerbals to live (until they are rescued)

This was my first launch and against my expectations it landend. The initial plan was to put it right next to my other lander (and in 1 piece).

As it turned out I landed it 1.1km from target and the engine fell off during the slightly rough landing. Next time I'm gonna put a camera on the botton of the ship and horizontal-rcs it closer to target.

Oh and no derbris was left during this mission boosters hit kerbin and main stage hit mun (retro burned just out of orbit, threw away main stage and re-orbited with lander)

http://imgur.com/a/9IB9x

Mods used : cart plugin, flood lights, core anvil pack, deep space mission pack, engineer, tiberdyne shuttle.
Cool, but how did you get rid of the Launch Tower?

It looks pretty cool, I'd like if they added a module kerbals to live in, which you could "dock" on the munar surface (or any other surface really) with some type of cart thingy under neath simmilar to what they do in this video (skip to 6.41 to see what I'm talking about)

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mupq8a71WkU

Cool, but how did you get rid of the Launch Tower?

Oh that's a mod I forgot to mention in the used mods list link over here : click

It looks pretty cool, I'd like if they added a module kerbals to live in, which you could "dock" on the munar surface (or any other surface really) with some type of cart thingy under neath simmilar to what they do in this video (skip to 6.41 to see what I'm talking about)

Cool video something like that is actually possible with the use of mods. I recorded a small example and put it on youtube. Just two simple carts docking but the munar base you mention could be constructed this way.

The mod I used to dock : click

To dock on surface you do not need to use the computer system (don't need to use it anyways, not sure if you can leave it off the craft). But I put it on my craft anyways, just put a docking target on one craft and a docking system on the other. Then gently bumb them into eachother.
Yes I know you can do it with mods, but It'd be cool to see it implemented in the vanilla game, anyway defenetly trying this
